events.event_name: Czech National Bank Interest Rate Decision
events.description: The Czech National Bank kept its two-week repo rate unchanged at 3.5% in February 2026.

facts.fact_text: The Czech National Bank kept its two-week repo rate unchanged at 3.5% in February 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The Czech National Bank kept its two-week repo rate unchanged at 3.5% in February 2026

facts.fact_text: The rate has been maintained at 3.5% since May 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: maintaining the level seen since May 2025

facts.fact_text: Headline inflation eased to 1.6% in January, a nine-year low.

evidences.evidence_text: headline inflation eased more than expected to a nine-year low of 1.6% in January, down from 2.1% in December
closely monitored services inflation remained elevated at 4.7%

claims.claim_text: Czech policymakers may have scope to cut rates this year.

evidences.evidence_text: Czech policymakers may have scope to cut rates this year, though further evidence of easing inflationary pressures will be needed to justify such a move.

claims.claim_text: Further evidence of easing inflationary pressures will be needed to justify a rate cut.

evidences.evidence_text: though further evidence of easing inflationary pressures will be needed to justify such a move.

evidence.evidence_text: Czech National Bank Leaves Interest Rates Steady
though further evidence of easing inflationary pressures will be needed to justify such a move.
Policymakers have repeatedly cited domestic risks, including the budget deficit, rapidly rising service and housing costs, and wage growth, as obstacles to further monetary easing.
